description: Remove dark theme, make light theme the only theme, and add version display in footer

userStories.title: Remove dark theme CSS and make light theme the root default
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the dark theme CSS removed and the light theme values set as the :root defaults so there is no theme-switching logic.
acceptanceCriteria: :root CSS variables in base.html use the current light theme values (--bg: #f8f7ff, --bg-subtle: #efeeff, --card: #ffffff, --text: #05013f, --text-muted: #5a5680, etc.)
[data-theme="light"] CSS block is removed (values are now in :root)
No [data-theme="dark"] or dark-theme-specific CSS blocks remain in base.html
data-theme attribute is removed from the <html> element in base.html
All components render correctly with light theme colors
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Remove theme toggle button and JavaScript from base.html
userStories.description: As a user, I want a clean header without a theme toggle button, and as a developer I want the theme-switching JavaScript removed.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme toggle button (.theme-toggle) with sun/moon SVG icons is removed from the header in base.html
Header layout remains visually balanced without the toggle (no empty space or misalignment)
Theme toggle event listener JavaScript is removed from base.html
localStorage.getItem('theme') and localStorage.setItem('theme', ...) calls are removed
document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', ...) calls are removed
No JavaScript errors in the browser console after removal
Typecheck passes

acceptanceCriteria: Login page (src/blueprints/auth/templates/auth/login.html) uses light theme colors

userStories.title: Add APP_VERSION environment variable to config
userStories.description: As a developer, I want an APP_VERSION environment variable so the version string can be configured per deployment.
acceptanceCriteria: APP_VERSION read via os.environ.get('APP_VERSION', 'v2.0') in src/config.py on the base Config class
Defaults to 'v2.0' if the environment variable is not set
Version value available in all Jinja2 templates via a context processor in src/app.py (e.g., inject app_version into template context)

userStories.description: As a user, I want to see the current application version in the footer so I know which version is deployed.
acceptanceCriteria: Version string (e.g., 'v2.0') is displayed right-aligned in the footer via a new <span> element
Version uses the app_version value injected by the context processor
Footer still shows copyright text on the left
Footer layout is responsive (stacks on mobile per existing @media rules)
Version text uses --text-muted color and 12px font size (consistent with existing footer styling)
